data.title: 125th anniversary of the death of Karl Weierstrass
data.meta_description: On the occasion of this anniversary the Mathematics Library is hosting an exhibition in the reading room.
data.text: 125 years ago today, on 19 February 1897, the famous mathematician Karl Weierstrass died in Berlin. On the occasion of the anniversary of his death, we are showing a small exhibition in our reading room. Among other things, there are original transcripts (handwritten!) from his lectures in the 1870s. At that time, Weierstrass taught mathematics at the Königliches Gewerbeinstitut, which later became the Technische Universität Berlin. His collected works and biographies are available for browsing. And then there's Weierstrass's monster...
